oai_dc:dc.dc:title: SUPPORTED IRON, COBALT AND IRON COBALT BIMETALLIC CATALYSTS FOR FISCHER-TROPSCH SYNTHESIS - CATALYST PREPARATION AND CHARACTERIZATION
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: BANERJEE, D
CHAKRABARTY, DK
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Iron, cobalt and iron-cobalt bimetallic catalysts with different metal loadings supported on silica and titania were prepared by impregnation and coimpregnation techniques. These catalysts were examined by X-ray diffraction, infrared spectroscopy and temperature programmed reduction. Reduction of the supported iron salts was difficult irrespective of the pretreatment, and cobalt was easier to reduce if it was not oxidised prior to reduction. Reduction of iron in the bimetallics is easier due to the presence of cobalt. Titania interacts more strongly with the oxides of iron and cobalt making it difficult to reduce them.
